INGREDIENTS:


•Onion - 1 cup chopped
 •Tomato - 1 cup chopped
 •Rajma/red kidney beans -1/2 cup
 •Ginger garlic paste - 1 tsp
 •Turmeric powder - 1/4 tsp
 •Chilli powder - 1 - 1 1/2 tsp
 •Coriander powder - 1 tsp
 •Cumin powder/jeera powder - 1 tsp
 •Garam masala powder -1/2 tsp
 •Salt as required
 •Oil -1 1/2 -2 tbsp (or butter + oil mixed together) 


PREPARATION: 
 1.Wash and soak rajma overnight. Rinse and pressure cook rajma for 5 whistles with a little salt and just enough water to soak the rajma. Rajma should be soft. 


METHOD: 
 1.Heat 1 tbsp of oil, add chopped onions and fry until onion turns golden brown. Keep stirring continuously for even browning. Add ginger garlic paste and fry for a few more seconds. 

2.Then add chopped tomatoes, chilli powder, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, salt needed and cook until tomatoes become mushy and oozes out oil. 

3.Now leave it to cool. After it cools grind it to a smooth paste. 

4.Heat another half tbsp of oil, add the ground paste, saute for a few seconds (as we have already cooked the onion and tomatoes well, you need not saute for more than a few seconds) and add the cooked rajma along with the water. 

5.Add more water if required, simmer for few minutes until everything gets blended well. 
 6.Alternatively you can pressure cook for another 1 whistle if you ae preparing it in a pressure pan. Once the pressure subsides, open the cooker and boil for few minutes until everything gets blended well. 

7.Sprinkle a pinch of garam masala and garnish with coriander leaves. Delicious Punjabi Rajma is ready. Serve hot with rice or roti or parathas or naan.
